comment: Dr. Eisenberg is a wonderful professor. She is passionate and knowledgeable about the material that she teaches, she works hard to engage students with thought-provoking questions and always gives great and thorough feedback on papers.
I loved Prof. Eisenberg! She's been a delight to my college experience and is someone I would recommend to anyone who's interested in Gender and Women's Studies.

I  loved Dr. Eisenberg! I mean, I'm sure it helped that I have pretty liberal views on things, but I absolutely loved this class and the professor! She's open to others opinions and doesn't look down upon those that don't agree with her.
Professor Eisenbergs class  is an easy A if you put twenty minutes of effort in every week you get an A.

I really disliked her class. Her lectures were long and boring. She doesn't let you even glance at your phone/laptop without calling you out. She basically makes people participate by calling on you. She is a fan of group projects which I hate. She made me feel as if I were still in high school. Counts you absent if you are more than 5 mins late.

Focuses a LOT on GLBTQ/gender/women studies in the history lectures and reading. Midterm and final were pretty hard and you won't pass if you didn't take REALLY good notes during class I thought I aced it and got an 85. You have a lot of interesting in class discussions! She'll call you out if you have your phone out but would totally take he again

She's a great professor, and I would definitely take her again! There is a lot of reading required, but the books are pretty interesting. You get 5 absences and she doesn't really differentiate between excused and unexcused.

Its a pretty easy class, shes a very easy grader. But you gotta show up. She gives you 5 days which you can be absent from class but after that your grade will take a hit. Otherwise the class was a cakewalk.
